thread.title: Top-10 finishing order after Stage 2 in the Daytona 500
thread.title_full: Top-10 finishing order after Stage 2 in the Daytona 500

title: Top-10 finishing order after Stage 2 in the Daytona 500
text:
Feb 26, 2017 at 4:59p ET 0Shares 
The second stage of the 2017 Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series has ended at the Lap 120 mark of the 59 th running of the Daytona 500. 
The winner of the stage receives 10 regular season points and one playoff bonus point, while the top-10 finishers receive points from 10-to-1 in declining order. 
Kyle Busch won the first stage at the Lap 60 mark in the Great American Race. 
Check out the top-10 drivers from the end of Stage 2 in the Daytona 500: Peter Casey Peter Casey-USA TODAY Sports 1 Kevin Harvick, 10 points (1 playoff point) 
Kevin Harvick led the Ford gang of drivers to the line to lead the end of Stage 2. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 2 Joey Logano, 9 
Logano has been up and down throughout the race but has himself in good position heading into the final stage. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 3 Kurt Busch, 8 
Along with his Stewart-Haas Racing teammates, Kurt Busch grabs points for his third-place Stage 2 finish. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 4 Brad Keselowski, 7 
Keselowski finds himself among five Ford drivers at the top of the leaderboard at the end of the stage. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 5 Danica Patrick, 6 
Patrick has finished in the top 10 for both of the opening stages in the 500. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 6 
Allmendinger climbed his way up through the field throughout the race. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 7 Clint Bowyer, 4 
After getting some right rear damage and battling from the back of the field, Bowyer grabbed some points at the end of the stage. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 8 Kyle Larson, 3 
Larson charged up to the top 10 in the closing laps of the stage to grab some points. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 9 
Newman has quietly found his way to the top 10. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports 10 Ryan Blaney, 1 
Blaney made some bold moves and fell back before sneaking his way into the 10th spot at the stage close. Jasen Vinlove Jasen Vinlove-USA TODAY Sports
